Review section: in the game you play as CJ, the first black protaganist in a GTA game. The game takes place in I believe the late 80's early 90's era. So as a black protaganist there is a good chunk of racism that you may encounter for that time period, which is relistic. You also got to deal with gang wars, which are pretty fun to trigger to get teritories, and there are also betrayel that happens and some shady business with cops. All in all the story is pretty good, and the towns and cities that the game takes place in are different enough that you can easily tell them all apart and they don't seem out of place at all. The missions and diologue in this are also good, except for the flying missions.

Cara, esse jogo é amor e ódio puro. Ao mesmo tempo que tem missões e histórias fodas, o fato de você ter que colocar mods de gráficos para deixar ele do jeito que sempre deveria ter sido, eu acho ultrajante para m jogo desse porte, vinda da época que a Rockstar não fazia tanta merda á respeito do lançava.
 Zerei o jogo 100%, foi uma ótima experiência no quesito de divertimento, consegui realmente fazer uma coisa que (acho eu) poucos tem coragem de fazer. Essa jornada foi foda, amo e amarei esse jogo sempre, graças á tudo que ele me proporcionou quando criança. E sim, digo isso pela nostalgia, mas admito que o porte da versão 1.0 para a versão 3.0 da steam é simplesmente porco, sendo obrigado a fazer downgrade para a 1.0, pois causa problemas técnicos de limitação de frames e também visuais pelos gráficos não terem sido bem-tratados de um porte á outro.
 Após tudo isso que passei jogando, admito que zeraria de novo, mas com mais moderação, porque 100% é muito puxado e demanda tempo. Se forem jogar, vejam o vídeo do FILIPE RAMOS de 5 anos atrás sobre os mods que ele coloca no gta san andreas, e só assim você terá uma boa experiência.
(Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=38OkRFX41K4&t=)
 Valeu por ter lido, tenha uma boa tarde/noite ou um bom dia, e tchauô...

GTA:SA is among the best video games ever made, for sure. Sadly Rockstar removed the original PC version on Steam in favor of a re-release of the original trilogy which, by the way, is a total flop. Rockstar ported it out to a 3rd party mobile game company and it shows. 

So I strongly recommend purchasing either a PS2 or an original Xbox and buying the GTA trilogy for your system, because they're the original games. No missing songs, no altered gameplay, ect. You can also try buying an original CD copy for the PC on Ebay, but that's more work because you'll have to mod it for a good experience. But whatever you do, don't give Rockstar money for their terrible product.

"Do you recommend this game?"

Yes, I do. It's an iconic game which defines an era of gaming we'll never return to. It was daringly controversial and tackled an assortment of political and societal issues through comedy and satire while delivering a compelling story with engaging gameplay. It was one of Rockstar's greatest achievements before succumbing to greed.

Since they've removed your option to buy it, and their overpriced remake is a broken pile of garbage, I can only hope you defy all odds and find a way to enjoy it through this torrent of criticism. If you ever find a way to emulate the enjoyment many of us fondly recall, I suggest you seize it.

Pros:
+ Simple yet detailed art style that aged really well
+ Diversity of radio stations
+ Huge map with lots of detail
+ Lots of side activities to undertake
+ Great amount of customization for both cars and your character
+ Iconic voice acting
+ Stats for just about anything
+ Orange glow from the PS2 returns thanks to mods
+ High replayability despite linear mission structure
+ Huge weapon arsenal; I didn't even find all of them on my first playthrough
+ Gang Warfare; it's a great way to up weapon stat but also illustrates they weren't joking about others having AK's
+ You can recruit Grove Street gang members to help you out
+ You can skip the stats grind by completing certain Sub-Missions
+ Improved controller controls; targeting enemies shows their health and switching is faster/more reliable

Cons:
- 30fps lock with issues that can occur when unlocking it
- Physics issues such as Cesar's car flipping way faster than it already would
- When alt tabbing the game can lock you on a black screen requiring you to use Task Manager (set to Always On Top) to close it
- CJ doesn't hide his gun when looking forward in a car which looks rather silly
- Missions that replace your weapon also reset the ammo count; doesn't always make sense since a lot of them share the same ammo
- The recruitable gang members don't do much unless ordered and CJ's audio seems to bug out at times causing him to constantly talk to them
- Opening Steam Overlay causes hitching
- Assets still don't show on the map
- No autosave; this should at least have been optional for the PC release since it's way more prone to crashing/locking
- Texture seams (right word?) of the environment glitch out at times
- Buying weapons is weirdly slow since you have to wait for a few seconds each time
- Needing to use mods to restore several features such as the orange glow and missing songs

Despite the clunkiness, tech issues and occasional frustration from these things I enjoyed Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas just as much, if not more, as when I first played it on the PS2. 
I strongly recommend you to find a key from a trustworthy source or to buy the original game on disc somewhere!

Download this first, BEFORE YOU BUY:
All Patch Combine: [url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/at2tx7e5gwwu7ph/Grand%20Theft%20Auto%20San%20Andreas%20RESENTMENT%20PATCH%20%28v1.4%29.rar?dl=0]GTA San Andreas RESENTMENT Patch[/url]

A RE-REVIEW for this nostalgic gem. I do loved it, but working this game to work properly and functional is very difficult. After a deep research of fixes and patches and it's directory, I manage to get the game working. GTA San Andreas has been a wonderful masterpiece.

You play as CJ, an exile Gangster who ran away from home, because his brother Brian got killed, now return home because his mother died. In addition, the story progress towards "The Hood, Families and Betrayal". It's GTA, so you know, kill people, steal cars, racing and many-many more to do.

As a I said, San Andreas has been a very nostalgic masterpiece in the old era of Open World Games. From it's world, story, characters and gameplay. World is very large to explore, story is very engaging, gameplay is fun, while missions, well, it has flaws, particularly the Flying Plane mission from both Zero and Mike Toreno.

As for flaws, the game mainly flaws towards it's technical issues. Because of the removal songs (FOR EXAMPLE: Killing in the Name by RATM), the game had an issues from Audio, crashes and many technical error. For example, without THE PATCH ABOVE, shooting cars until they exploded can cause a serious of annoying crashes. Switching radio because of the missing songs can crash as well. Also, if you TURN OFF FRAME LIMITER, the game instantly broken. So, you have to play the game in 26FPS (With PATCH ABOVE YOU CAN ONLY PLAY IT IN 30FPS).

What else is there? Ummm, oh yeah. There are tons of cool mods in the GTA Community that adjusted the game that could best suit your play style. In any case, the game is still enjoyable, but downgrading and fixing the damn game are a really serious pain in the A$$.

Recommended to Purchase it with the GTA TRILOGY BUNDLE.

Then, Rockstar / Take-Two released a "definitive" (more like "definitively horrible") edition of the original trilogy which is exclusive to their launcher, has an art-style which can be accurately described as lazily abominable, and is riddled with bugs. Oh, and it costs [b]$60 dollars.[/b]

As of November of 2021, many people are demanding refunds for this terrible product and haven't received it.

And to top it all off, Rockstar / Take-Two removed the original GTA trilogy from all storefronts. The original GTA trilogy can no longer be obtained legally, unless you buy used physical versions for PC or consoles.

[b]DO NOT BUY ANY PRODUCT from Rockstar Games and/or Take-Two Interactive.[/b] They treat their customers like complete filth, and do NOT deserve your hard earned money. Not even half a cent.

[h1]I’ll have two number 9s, a number 9 large, a number 6 with extra dip, a number 7, two number 45s, one with cheese, and a large soda.[/h1]

[i]GTA San Andreas is considered the best game in the GTA series. In some degree that is true, but the best way of playing this game is pretty much impossible in this time of age. Don't get me wrong, I do like this game. I just find this PC port to be very lackluster in terms of Quality and Stability.[/i]

I would say I did enjoy my time with this game, though I do think the game ​length and open world scale and aspect to be a little too big for my tastes.

The story's pretty good. I like the characters and how everything progresses. As for gameplay, I would say it's better then Grand Theft Auto 3 and mostly Vice City. Though car handling is pretty mediocre in my opinion. The Atmosphere is there, but kind of lackluster in some places. The missions are more unique and enjoyable, but they do go on a little too long.

As for this PC port it's pretty poor. Playing this game with a custom soundtrack is incompatible. Half the time it works, half the time it just crashes your game. My first two hours was with me wrestling with the game, wondering why it kept crashing a lot and seeing what was causing my game to crash constantly. Turns out that the custom soundtrack was causing the problem. The other thing that was causing my game to crash constantly is to have the framerate limiter off. I did eventually find a mod that fixes this problem plus made the game compatible to run/limit the game at 60fps instead of 25fps, but this doesn't resolved the many bugs and performance issues at this game has.

I guess you can call the PS2 version the best one out of the bunch of other ports, but playing this game at a native 1080p or 4k at 60fps or higher is something that most people craves more instead of 480p at 25fps on old and mostly Expensive Hardware.

[i]GTA San Andreas needs a proper remaster desperately, because the only thing that's holding this game back is it's technical issues.[/i]

[u][b]Overall[/b][/u]
A really good game to say the least, but plagued with technical issues. [u]I would recommend installing "GTA San Andreas Definitive Edition" to fix most of the issues, but does not fix everything about this port...[/u]

Link: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=720460154

[u]I would recommend this game to anyone that are fans of the GTA series or Open World Genre.[/u]

EDIT: After the initial releases of the GTA Remasters or the "Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy" – """""The Definitive Edition""""". The original PC or PS2 versions are sadly better than the Remaster. Get the originals instead ~ https://www.ebay.com/b/Grand-Theft-Auto-San-Andreas-PC-Video-Games/139973/bn_80343342

Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas was a classic, something I personally grew up with playing, from the countless myths and supposed cheat codes that we thought existed that spurred from this game, to the abundant amount of modifications you could apply thanks to the community - most of which has been taken down at the threat of a lawsuit from Take-Two Interactive / Rockstar Games... it's an experience I wish wasn't taken down from the Steam store, because now anyone on here looking to play the originals can't, they have to settle for the vain hope that the definitive edition comes out in better condition then what we got for all of a day.

Not to mention not everyone will be able to RUN the definitive edition, the requirements are MUCH higher and so anyone who was able to play the originals or met the specifications for the original may very well not be able to run the remaster.

A real shame, but there's very little that can be done. We can only express our distaste in Rockstar Games' terrible choices here and hope they listen and restore this masterpiece of a game on the Steam store as a (CLASSIC) version like many other games have done that have been remastered.

This is one of the greatest games in existence. I beat the Xbox 360 port of this game several times when I was in high school, and I watched a friend of mine beat it for the first time on my PC last year. This game is legitimately a masterpiece (it is much better than GTA V, in my opinion)...everything from the characters, the music selection, the voice acting, the story, the lore, the environments, and everything in between is pretty close to perfect. Even if you've watched gameplay of this title on YouTube, you need to pick it up (full price, don't even wait for a sale) and play it for yourself. Even beyond the main story, it's just fun to play and explore the environment. I believe most people who own this game (and are old enough to remember) will have fond memories of playing this game at 3 in the morning hunting for bigfoot or some other myth on Mount Chilliad with foggy weather/rain on at night in the game after watching too much DarkMythHunter on YouTube. This game is a gem, a true diamond in the rough...pick it up and play it, you owe it to yourself.

I can only recommend this to those who are willing to go the extra mile to fix the game with mods, as the current version is a port of the mobile port. (Which it self is a port of the original PC version.) TLDR; The mobile port introduced a multitude of bugs, removed content and is generally unpolished. The best way to play SA on PC right now (In before the remaster.) is to downgrade this version with a community tool. There are many community guides on how to do that. If you don't want to mod the game, then just play it on console (PS2, Xbox) or emulate it. This version sucks.

Apart from the odd bug in the game, this game is the best GTA game I've ever played.
Only problems that are faced are:
   - Game sometimes crashes on first startup
   - No controller button hints (Just says things like "press JOY4")

Despite these minor annoyances this is a well optimised and fun game to play.

Definitely recommend!

[h1]GTA系列的傳奇[/h1]
優勝之處：
+ 加Mod來玩是超棒
+ 超豐富的故事線

個人感想：
失望啊，一代神作要在Steam上下架了。

I decided it wouldn't be fair to review this game based on downgrading, which one might argue is a mod, and how I got the game to work originally, so instead I did a play through from steam. I had previously played GTA liberty city and GTA vice city on steam, again, no modding.

Sadly as I hit 90% ish the game got taken down from the steam store, so if you're reading this, you already own it, as those who do not have this cannot access the store page (or if they can they certainly cannot buy it).

For reference I played this using proton as my OS is arch linux. 1080 GPU - 16GB RAM, i7-7700K CPU, not that any of that should matter for a game this old.
I used X11 and not wayland, but experienced the lack of stability on both when starting out.

The gameplay itself doesn't tend to be **that** buggy. There are still some ingame glitches to exploit (biggest one being infinite time on the bike challenge in the docks of san fierro next to the import/export. Interestingly I couldn't trigger it on the BMX.

In terms of stability though this thing is hell.
Going through any cutscene (that includes exiting and entering homes, shops, watching the cutscenes in missions) can cause the game to crash. The game doesn't always know it's crashed (usually not) and this requires killing it manually.
When loading back up it often glitches on the loading screen, resolved through completely killing the game and steam.
Other times it knows it's crashing and exits itself.

This means when destroying my own vehicle in a race to restart it, boom, crash (and as other races were not saved, had to redo those as well).

Did the first part of the last mission, flipped my car on the second part, crash. No ability to save inbetween, had to restart last mission.

Got to certain points in the last mission, crash between parts, have to restart last mission.

The story line is brilliant, the character development enjoyable, the game play and missions well thought through.
It's just a shame the steam version is SO unstable, and the developer seems to have hated a lot on mods, so getting this working if they ever make it available again seems unlikely.

I hope upon hope that the next GTA version is not so buggy. These bugs were not experienced in LC or VC.

---[h1] One of the classics [/h1]---

Become a gangster and return your hood from enemy gang, this and more you can do in this game.

---[h1] The story so far [/h1]---

You take a role of Carl Johnson (CJ), Who leaves his hometown due of death of his younger brother. After information about mother's death he returns and starts fixing everything he screwed up. Reunite with your friends (ᵗʷᵒ ᵒᶠ ᵗʰᵉᵐ ᵇᵉᵗʳᵃʸˢ ʸᵒᵘ), meet new friends, prvoke gang wars, complete sub-missions, find secrets and hang out while enjoying the delights of San Andreas.

---[h1] Addictive gameplay [/h1]---

Ever wanted to swin. Now you can! Want action? Here you go! Want to find secrets after complete story? No problem, Do you want adult humor, finding it here and there? Yes, no questions asked. This and everything you can do in this game for fun.

---[h1] Conclusion [/h1]---

This game is addictive, never thought i'll recomplete the game over and over. This game has good design, wonderful landscapes, amazing gameplay and more.

[h1] A true classic [/h1] 
This was the first GTA I ever played.
I remember getting the newest GTA for the original xbox and enjoyed playing back then and even to this day it's fun to pick up once in a while.

[h1] Story [/h1] 
Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas consists of a great story that remains fun every playthrough!

[h1] Rating [/h1] 
The graphics look dated (But what did you expect from a game released in 2004).
Many MANY mods to alter the gameplay experience, from HD textures to completely new story line.
The Steam version is meh at best but there are 1.0 downgraders available all over the web so that isn't a big issue for me.
Gameplay and physics also start to show their age, but then again, nothing that mods can't fix.

San Andreas is an amazing game, in fact, it's probably the best game in the whole GTA franchise. Unfortunately, the Steam version sucks big time. It's buggy, lacks content from the original PC version, and can not be modded. The random crashes and other major bugs result in the game being almost unplayable. If you want to play GTA San Andreas on the PC get a boxed retail version and play it on a retro PC with Windows XP installed on it. That's probably the least painful way to get to enjoy GTA San Andreas on the PC. Looking forward for the remastered editions though I'm pretty sure they're just going to end up being patched up versions of the original games. Rockstar, please don't f- it up!

By the 1950s, the Abstract Expressionists had firmly taken over the imagination of the art world. Everywhere, artists were striving to connect with the primeval self, the unconscious mind, and the hidden imagery of the subconscious. In the midst of this fervor emerged a trend toward calmness, born partially from a growing interest among many artists in Eastern philosophies like Taoism and Zen Buddhism. One of the most profound movements to grow out of this time was a game named Grand Theft Auto San Andreas.  

This work embraces color, while placing equal power on line. It embraces simplicity while simultaneously communicating vastness, complexity and a sense of interwoven interdependence. 

This games furious energy envelops the viewer and seems to burst off the canvas. There is a shocking vitality to it, aggression that transfers emotion and fury into space. At a time when many game company's considered Abstraction to have played itself out, Rockstar injected a powerful new life force into the style.  

Grand Theft Auto San Andreas continues to open new doors to us as we try to comprehend the endless complexities our evolving society presents us with. Just a Classic of video game. 10/10

Words really can not describe this game ...
I remember spending most of my childhood playing this game, and I always enjoyed playing it. I was always trying to discover new things about the game and I have to say that Rockstar never disappointed me in this.
The more you look, the more new things await you to discover.
The best possible characterization, the best possible features compared to the year of release, the best scenario, the best possible environment design, extremely beautiful, diverse and attractive stages, except for the Zero stages and certifications :)
CJ was really a character that I'm sure all the gamers loved, and he also loved Grove Street.
As I said, this game can not be described in words and we can talk for a whole month about the interesting points of the game and the memories we have with the game.
The last thing I want to say is that I really want from the bottom of my heart that the remaster of this game is so good that we drown in it again ... :) I hope Rockstar will surprise us again, of course in a positive way.

Well here we are folks, the existing versions of Grand Theft Auto 3, Grand Theft Auto: Vice City, and Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas have been removed from digital storefronts. I personally as a fan seriously pissed at this fact, Rockstar Games is THE game studio i grew up with and all of their games mean a hella lot to me and countless hours i spent in them shows how much i was supporting them across the years. 

The current versions of classic GTA's are about to be replaced with "The Definitive Trilogy" collection which will also be a RGL exclusive on pc. On paper it sounds fine except Rockstar delisted the games before we have even saw any gameplay, release date or even a sightliest screenshot of how this collection might look like, it is such a scummy move from their side it feels like they don't even care about their games anymore nor the fans.

Exhibit A: Shutting down mod projects.
Take-Two reportedly sent "private investigators" to modder's homes across the US, took down lots of different modding websites and those who refused were heavily harassed by the Take-Two's legal team. Even when the mod requires a genuine copy of the game like GTA V's FiveM or reVC (a reverse engineered source port of GTA VC on different platforms) still got shut down even when they were doing everything according the rules Take-Two submitted themselves back in 2017 modders backlash

Exhibit B: Rockstar and Take Two's milking of GTA Online
As 2021 coming to an end the third re-release of GTA V (A GAME THAT'S BEEN INITIALLY RELEASED BACK IN 2013 ON PS3 AND 360) is coming closer and closer each day. GTA online had such huge, widely dynamic potential at the beginning and it just failed at every turn. Numerous bugs and issues that's been there since day 1 are still intact(loading times, griefing, ludicrous jobs, server connection problems, constant grind) and there's no sign of them being fixed. Yet people still keep playing it and throwing their money on micro transactions that gives them advantage over other players and gives them an opportunity to skip the grind. This shitfest has been going on since the release and whatever sells makes Take-Two push their devs to produce as much content to this already bloated game even further. It's just sad that there aren't any alternatives to GTA Online not even a close example. GTA Online is worst by itself but it's the best at it's genre because not even a single game in the world could even come close to it. The re-release for the PS5 is another way for them to prolong 
the milking for that dirty revenue.

Conclusion:
Rockstar's games were always great too bad that their decisions on how to run things aren't. This delisting of classical game is another example on how Rockstar is going AWOL against their playerbase for no absolute reason. Now tbh pirating this games will give you more benefits and playing the game itself would definitely be one of them. It's a shame that they're shutting down mods, delisting old games as a sign that you should just go and waste your money on some virtual gta currency in their broken-ass online mode.

They're not any better than EA or Blizzard at this point.

This is a terrible version of one of the best video games of all time.

The Steam version is plagued with many issues such as
- Lack of mod support, most mods will crash the game when loading a file or starting a new game.
- Save files from older version straight up not working (which was broken by an update to this exact version!)
- Removed music, no Michael Jackson or Running Down A Dream for you, but hey at least you keep David Bowie and Toto.
- Lack of Windows 10 support, SA will straight up crash sometimes because it feels like it and the lazy idiots at R* can't be bothered to update this to work on modern machines meaning you have to download fan fixes eg SilentPatch.
- Widescreen is broken on this version, the aspect ratio was broken with an update and thus breaks free aiming as you won't aim where you shoot (GTA3 and VC also suffer from this)
- 60FPS bugs HAVE STILL NOT BEEN FIXED. This is a 16 year old problem and it has never been fixed, this applies to any Rockstar game on PC pre- Max Payne 3,
- Multiple fixes brought from the 1.1 PC version are not present here for some reason, including the fix for dirty cars.
- The minigames are out of sync and inverted, meaning instead of pressing the left arrow key you need to press the right and not only that, you have to press it JUST BEFORE it goes in the circle.
- Sometimes the camera will not function at all, meaning you have to spam ESC (or whatever your pause key is) whilst rapidly moving your camera to fix it. This was sort of fixed on the RGL version but it introduced another issue of the camera going crazy.

Pros
- It's on Steam I guess
- Cloud saves (it's 2021 for christ's sake)

Seriously, if you do buy it install all the fixes and the 1.0/1.1 exes and the old radio, it's practically needed to make this thing run on modern systems with no problems.

If the rumors of a remaster of both this and the other trilogy games are true, don't get this and wait on that.
From what I can gather, each games are masterpeices for their time, however, right now:

- High Framerates break several systems of the game, including making it so you can't dive underwater, making a mission later into the game impossible.

- Lowrider and Dancing challenges are impossible UNLESS you rebind controls because they aren't properly bound by default.

- The map can often be too confusing to navigate without the waypoint system from the HD Games.

- Due to the lack of checkpoints in missions, or the system GTA IV gives you (allowing you to restart from the beginning the moment you fail), failing the missions becomes too annoying to be bothered with, as you'll have to either drive from one side of the town to start again, then back to get a second chance, OR, drive from one side of the map to start, then back to continue.

- A lot of mechanics feel outdated, like how you switch through weapons or switch clothes.

- As of now, from what I can gather, the game's best played when modded.

For these reasons, and MAYBE more since I genuinely can't be fucked to finish it, I would wait to see if the rumored remasters are going to happen. If they do, get that one, not this one. If they don't, get this one and find some mods you'd like.

Though, if you want some positives:

- The Gameplay is different from newer GTA games in a good and fun way.

- The map feels bigger (despite being factually smaller) and more lively than GTA5, due to having multiple cities, rather than just Los Santos and two small towns.

- The characters are honestly great, and I heard amazing things about it's story, and from what I've seen of it (a little over half, I believe), I think I can at least back up the first half of the game before leaving Los Santos for being really damn good.

- Lots of customization with CJ, from him being skinny to muscular to fat, with different tatoos with different hair styles, with different clothes, plenty of good with this game.

If you want a better version of grand theft auto san andreas, what I recommend you do is:


Downgrade *all* your games files to 1.0, yes, even the 1.0 exe (but we will not be using that version. - Use this to downgrade your game: https://gtaforums.com/topic/936600-iii-iv-various-gta-downgraders/ MAKE SURE TO CHOOSE GTA SA AND NOT ANY OTHER VERSION LMAO)

Then goto this github link and download this: https://github.com/MrNiceGuy420/GTA-SA-1.0-HOODLUM-No-CD-Fix-exe and then put it in your gta sa folder, and launch the game from that ONLY

Once you have done that, install:

Modloader (https://www.gtagarage.com/mods/show.php?id=25377)
CLEO (https://cleo.li/)
Limit Adjuster (I personally choose http://fastman92.com/11-fastman92-limit-adjuster-4-3)
The "Essentials" Mod List (By the way, some of these will already be included. Such as a limit adjuster being in this pack, modloader, cleo, an ASI Loader, etc. So what I recommend you do is install:

(by the way, make a folder called 'Essentials' in your 'Modloader' directory and put these files from the below section inside of there.)

NoDEP
RunDLL32Fix
Framerate Vigilante (Allows you to play the game at 60fps and higher w/o any game engine problems)
Cleo+ (Extract cleo+ to your CLEO folder and not your modloader folder)
SilentPatch
Borderless Window (Now you can alt tab w/o crashing :D)
Widescreen Fix (Can now choose 1920x1080 resolutions, or higher.)
Widescreen Fix HOR+ Support (dunno what this does but guess its nice to have lmao)
Silents ASI Loader (handy in case cleo messes up, great to use anyway.)

Optional Stuff to download and possibly use:

Fastloader (this effectively immediately boots you into the 'new game' or 'continue game w/ save file of choice' (iirc), handy if you're seeing if your game will crash with a crap ton of mods installed.)

Mixsets (I honestly saw that this caused more problems for my GTA than it had caused good, however if you manually change settings in the game for your liking, it can be pretty good.)

Aww well, you can install Multi Theft Auto, or SAMP if you want to play multiplayer GTA SA. SAMP supports mods like framerate vigilante and other mods, but MTA on the other hand is taboo to me, dunno if it  can support mods or not.

All We Had To Do Was Follow The Damn Train CJ!!
Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is probably one of the most memorable PlayStation 2 titles most people will remember even to this date. Chronologically San Andreas is set sometime in the early 1990s, a few years after Vice City in Rockstar’s 3D Universe timeline.

Like its predecessor, San Andreas puts you in the shoes of a central character about to embark on a life of crime. However, CJ or Carl Johnson as you like it is no career mobster like Tommy Vercetti from Vice City. In fact, he's been away from “the hood for five years” to try and escape the gang violence that’s been plagued in his home city of Los Santos. He's brought back by his mother's untimely death. Hooking up with his brother Sweet and old friends, CJ is inevitably drawn back into the world he had left behind a world of guns, drugs, territory, casual violence and respect.

Rockstar Games took the satirical drama to the next level. The scope and size of the game is incredible. It will literally take you hours to explore the entire map on foot (which is pointless because of the large array of vehicles available). The story, mood and setting are heavily influenced by the hip hop culture of the 90s, and many rap artists are prominently featured on the soundtrack.

Rockstar really pushed the bar for video game standards with rich detailed open world with three expansive areas that feel very distinct from one another. When people say Rockstar Games is the “king” of open world games it’s because of this reason right here! It has got everything you would want in an open world game! The graphics, the music, the voice acting, the mini games, open world activities. When everything is put together it is phenomenal if you think all of this was possible on PS2!

We have famous voices such as Samuel L. Jackson who voices Officer Tenpenny, James Woods who voices Mike Toreno, Ice T who voices the in-game rapper Madd Dogg, and Chris Penn who voices Officer Eddie Pulaski. Our main character Carl, is voiced by Chiris Bellard who does a marvelous job of voicing Carl).

There are also many surprising cameos and references to Vice City and GTA3. This is one of the few games that managed to really flesh out even the small supporting characters. Hats off to the writers who took effort on character development for over 3/4th NPCs involved in the game’s story. The cast of characters, posters, memes, videos are some of the most iconic you’ll see on social media and internet.

Despite being a huge success, this isn’t a game I would recommend to new gamers simply because it hasn’t aged all that well. Some of the minor annoyances are:

-There are tons of problems with the Steam version. You might have to download some fan made patches, mods and fixes to make it work on your Windows 10 PC. There are quite a few bugs and glitches here and there that were never addressed by the developers. Additionally, bugs present in the Steam version were patched on retail version. Worse the steam version also doesn’t support the great mods so make sure to downgrade the game to retail version before trying to mod it. There are many detailed guides on this.
-Many soundtracks were removed on the game’s 10th Anniversary in 2014 to avoid licensing issues.
-The game is hard locked to 25 fps, trying to mess with it will fundamentally break the game and cause some massive physics glitches making some missions impossible to complete. Other classic Rockstar Games also suffer from this issue. Not a great PC port.
-Some of the missions can be a bit unfair and a real pain to deal with! There are no checkpoint saves so each time you fail a mission you’re forced to get back to the mission marker icon and restart the mission from scratch. Flying planes can be a real challenge and some of these missions also have mandatory training levels as well which can be a nightmare. You can’t progress the story forward without completing these.
-PC Controls are terrible and haven’t particularly aged very well in my opinion. Newly added features such as target aiming needed some polish and clearly shows the game engine being push hard.

Final Words
GTA San Andreas is a complete AAA package for 90s/00s gamers with amazing production value. The game sold over 25 million copies on PS2 alone. I think the audience response alone speaks volumes. Absolutely a great and fantastic way to have fun if you’re stuck with an old, low spec PC or a laptop. After checking out Cyberpunk 2077’s launch I can confidently that San Andreas offers more RPG elements and fun time than most actual role-playing games! It’s a cinematic story rich game, It’s a life sim, it’s open world game, it’s a driving game! it’s an immersive sim, it’s a fully customizable, moddable sandbox/playground! It’s all things combined into a single game! Highly recommend this game to everyone who missed out on this blockbuster title due to…whatever reason. Dude this is San Andreas!! Why are you even reading this!

My Rating: 10/10

It's still the best GTA game.  

Shocking is a good word to use for how 4 and 5 still don't come close to the sort of tight gameplay and customization options of San Andreas.  

With what might be the greatest licensed soundtrack in the history of video games, 100 missions across every inch of the map, and a superb cast voice talent (Samuel L Jackson being the standout), San Andreas is still a great joy to play even 17 years after it's release.  

Save often, though, as there were a few times where the game suddenly crashed and sent me to my desktop.
